column1: short outside off, swings away as Guptill chases it, Alex Carey is also on the move and the ball ends up at third man for a couple of extras
fullish, 142kph outside off, driven without timing to point
fired into the pads, Munro looks for his favoured leg-side pick up but doesn't connect... pitched outside, I think
short of a length, 142kph and swerving away as Guptill wafts a cut without foot movement and is beaten
angled in straight, 146kph/90mph and dabbed down into the leg side for one

full, heaved to leg... and into the crowd! Munro clears the pickets for the first time, looked a bit of a mishit as the ball ballooned into the sky, but it had the legs to go all the way. And one of the orangemen in the crowd missed his chance of $50,000, too! Completely misjudged it
short, slightly leg side, wide again
pitched up and driven, they take on Warner's arm at mid-off... but the throw is wide
length, 134kph and shaping a touch on middle and leg, Munro dabs wide of mid-on
slightly short of a length in the channel, maybe stays a bit low and Guptill fails to connect
pitched up and smeared back down the ground, whacked past mid-off for four!
length delivery outside off, punched square
drifting into the pads, Guptill just needs to get a tickle on it, past Carey and away to fine leg
full, comes on to the front foot and prods towards extra cover for a scampered one
pitched up on middle and off, pushed through mid-on
angled across, 133kph and Munro swaps power for placement, a deft guide past gully for four
short ball on the hip, Munro twocks it in front of square, superb timing and it races to the rope, beating the dive of man running up from deep square
pitched up and cracked over cover this time! Three fours in a row for Munro, stepping out to carve a lofted drive
outside off, maybe taking the pace off, punched to cover
length, 125kph and angling in, dabbed wide of the bowler in his follow through and they trot the single
tossed up and spanked back over long-on first ball! Guptill steps out and climbs into the spin, only just clears the short, straight boundary
dragged down, rocks back and bottom-edges a pull
fired in straight and worked for one
full, 104kph wide of leg stump, Munro chops it through midwicket
flat, skidding on as Guptill plays back, bottom-edged on the cut for one
darted outside leg stump again and this time Munro tries to reverse-slog over cover, gets an inside edge into his pads
full and straight, Guptill launches at it, gets a thick inside edge on to his boot
back of a length, Munro pulls powerfully but flat, just one to deep square leg

got him, toe-ended to mid-off! Backed away to try and thrash down the ground, completely mistimed and Warner revs the chainsaw in celebration. Stanlake with the breakthrough, Guptill goes (relatively) cheaply this time
attempted yorker, 146kph and squirming past the pads, nearly had Williamson off his feet - a touch leg side, though, a called wide
comes across and pokes into the covers
short of a length, slapped through cover point, that'll get him going... NZ raise 50 in the fifth over
full in the channel, 142kph and Williamson leans into a classy-looking cover drive, picks out the fielder
skips out, clumped down the ground - sails over long-on! Didn't quite get hold of it but on this ground, that's six

straight up this time, and taken at mid-on! Munro holes out, Agar pouching it safely as Richardson gives it the double-fist pump. Maybe a bit of pace off there... NZ momentum well and truly checked now
short of a length, rising up to be blocked back in the crease
angled across around off, tapped away
back of a length, 133kph and into the back pad, Chapman nudging across the line... High, I reckon
short and wide and lashed for four! Bit of room for the dinky dasher to throw his hands through the cut, gets it away
full, fourth-stump line, driven to cover on the bounce
dabbed into the covers, the throw to the non-striker's end flies away, but there's a man backing up eventually
back of a length outside off, swatted down the ground to long-off
short, 125kph and Williamson whirls on a pull, gets it past the dive of midwicket
on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
slower delivery, Chapman gets his pull past the ring this time and Williamson hares back to the danger end to make sure of two
lobbed up from round the wicket, nurdled towards wide long-on, just a single there
flat on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
floated up full and Williamson works it into the gap this time, Warner has to run across from long-on and they hustle back for two

timber! Tossed up by Agar, gets him trying to come down the ground, nowhere near the pitch and an ugly swipe leaves Williamson stranded, the ball thudding into off stump! Nicely bowled, this wasn't a dart - gave it some air and duped the batsman
flighted, Taylor comes out and turns it into a full toss, clipped square for one

tossed up and Chapman attempts to sweep, hit on the front pad - and given! After a moment's discussion, he decides to review, however... Looked pretty good to me, but maybe going on with the angle from round the wicket? No bat involved, it pitched in line and ball-tracking says it would have smashed off stump! Good decision from Wayne Knights and Agar has his second
full and straight and whipped off the toes, Chris Lynn moves across from midwicket and dives to try and cut it off... and he's hurt here, going to need some treatment
short outside off, cut firmly to the sweeper
length outside off, De Grandhomme sits back and guides a couple wide of third man
dug in, 140kph and he pulls, off the splice into a gap at midwicket for a couple
short again, De Grandhomme latches on this time and blitzes a pull up and over the ring, wide of long-on for four
dabbed to short third man, CDG turns to regain his ground as the throw comes in, then they trot the one
tossed up on off and punched down the ground
gets a touch too straight and Taylor glides it off his pads, gets it very fine and it runs away to the rope for four
pushed through on leg stump, blocked
floated up, worked down the ground

baits the hook, De Grandhomme bites... picks out cow corner! No great connection and there's a man out there waiting, the safe hands of Glenn Maxwell and Agar has a third wicket! Really not though through, that shot... NZ five down
fired into the toes, clipped through midwicket for one
full on the stumps, worked back down the ground to long-on
short and leg side, flies through as Santner pulls - was there glove on it? Yes! Tye banged in a fast bumper, Australia celebrated immediately and up went the finger. Oh dear
takes the pace off, defended on off stump
angled in on the stumps and worked to leg
short, 130kph outside off and rising through as Seifert ignores it
slower delivery on off, pushed into the covers for one to get off the mark
angled in with the arm from round the wicket, worked to leg for a single
floated up full and clipped back to the bowler
gives it some air, nudged into a gap at midwicket and they scamper the two
wheels away on middle and leg, clipped in front of square and Agar chases after it
flat, quicker ball, worked to leg again and Seifert has to gets his skates on
fired in and flicked to midwicket, just the one this time, brings up the NZ 100. Terrific figures for Agar, his best in T20Is
full, maybe a slower ball, skids through under the bat outside off
pitched up straight and worked into the leg side
back of a length, 128kph outside off and Seifert cuts firmly but picks out backward point

bowled 'im! Slips in the yorker again, seemed to go under the bat - in fact, Seifert just played the wrong line - and the ball thudded into the base of off stump. Good bowling, Australia applying the chokehold here
fired in and dinked for one
short ball, at the body, Taylor pulls but doesn't get hold of it
back of a length and worked from off stump to midwicket, Richardson has to give chase and they hurry back for two
angled in and worked to leg again, this time long-on comes in to prevent a second
full ball, clipped firmly off the pads, beats the diving attempt on the rope and that's a welcome boundary
slower ball, Southee heaves to leg - picks out deep midwicket! Another dumb slog without the air and it plops into the hands of Maxwell running in, took it low, took it well
full on the stumps, nudged into the gap at midwicket
short of a length, 139kph and Sodhi defends down to the leg side
full on the toes and Taylor nurdles into the leg side, they scamper hard for two
full, taking the pace off hits the pad and runs square
full, 137kph outside off and chopped towards point
slower delivery this time, slips through outside the line of off
full and straight, taking the pace off again, gets bat on it into the leg side
length outside off, Taylor cuts into the ground behind point for one
pitched up and driven for one to the edge of the ring
full toss, Sodhi taps it down into the off side, Taylor is quickly on the move as backward point fires in the throw
goes for the yorker again, 130kph cross-seam, Taylor chops down on it
slower ball, cut into the ground behind point, Richardson throws himself after it to keep them to one
pitched up, 130kph/80mph and drilled back to the bowler in his follow through
short and wide and clubbed, they take the single to deep cover
shortish, 137kph outside off, defended from the crease
straighter line and Sodhi clips a single to get Taylor on strike
short, wide and slashed past backward point! Travis Head, on as a sub fielder, nearly gets fingertips on it but the ball zips by and away to the rope for a first boundary in a while
this comes back in and hits the gloves as Taylor goes to cut again
banged in, good bumper to a No. 10, he flinches out of the way
length outside off, 141kph, steered down to third man
full and straight and tapped back, Richardson comes down to field
slower ball, goes back outside off and guides it wide of short third man for one
full outside off, 134kph and Taylor goes for the cow-corner mow, ends up toeing it back to the bowler
another dot, slow floater outside off and this induces a big swing and miss
fullish, pace off again, Taylor heaves across the line and fails to connect
pitched up and clubbed to leg, just one to the man on the boundary square
in the slot, pounded down the ground for six! Hello, my old friend... Taylor picks this and blooters it over long-on, NZ will take a couple more of those!
short, slower delivery and Taylor is hit on the body, Sodhi then has to throw himself back in as Stoinis fields and throws for the stumps
full, taking the pace off, again Taylor doesn't connect with a big mow across the line
pitched up and squirted into the leg side, Taylor is struggling to get back here... but Tye's throw is poor and Carey can't collect properly!
banged in as Taylor steps out, that's in a different post code on height
short ball outside off, Taylor creams a pull wide of long-on, Agar dives to cut it off but they come back for two
slower delivery, wide of the stumps, another swing and miss
full, slower ball, Sodhi spots it - and booms six more over long-on! Hefty whack and it goes waaaaay back into the crowd! Good start
full toss, swatted into the leg side for one
full and wide, 136kph and Taylor can only squeeze it to backward point as he advanced down the pitch
castled! Sodhi makes room and heaves across the line, Tye hits the top of middle! Sodhi runs straight off, he's done his job
full toss on off, Boult bunts it down the ground to bring Taylor on strike

banged in, 135kph and Taylor pulls like a lusty stevedore, takes it on the helmet, just a single to backward point! It's not much more than a hill of beans but Taylor has at least given NZ something to bowl at
full and straight, a hint of swing, tight line to the left-hander. A solid start
slightly back of a length this time, and hauled imperiously through midwicket! He timed the pants off that, with no apparent room to do so
fuller this time, but wide of off stump, Warner frees his arms and launches a mistimed drive over the covers. It plugs beyond the fielder and is gathered inside the rope
full and swinging, defended with caution back down the pitch
stabbed into the covers
full again, squeezed into the off side
looped up onto a good length, and dabbed back down the pitch
back of a length, tight line, flicked into the leg side
down on one knee for the slog sweep, strikes the pad but that pitched outside leg
that's a tremendous glide through third man, picking the legbreak and sliding it through the gap with an open face
nudged off the pads to backward square
pushed onto the back foot, defended back down the pitch, that's a tidy over
full length, but sliding into the pads, tucked to deep backward square
worked off the legs once more, a big stretch at backward square to intercept
flashed into the leg side
smashed hard down the ground, but he's miscued it, and Williamson at mid-off can't reach it! He was back on his heels, perhaps expecting the ball to come harder and faster
bunted out to deep midwicket
thrashed to deep point
turning into the legs from a good length, flipped off the hip to midwicket
more signs of turn from a middle and leg line, constricting Short's free-flowing arms
too short this time, and Short just leans back to slap another four through the off side. Easy peasy
on a good length, and tapped back to the bowler
a swish across the line but no real contact
on the back foot, sliding into a back-foot glide to  cover
thrashed into the off side, but can't beat the man at mid-off
that's a pounding shot. Overpitched from Boult, an attempted yorker, but ended up right in Short's arc, and was flashed back with interest just past the stumps
same again! In the slot, and slotted down the ground. Top biffing
on the back foot this time, stabbed to cover and they scuttle the run
worked out to short midwicket
hoisted off the back foot, high and handsome over the leg side! Boult's length, short and full, has been picked off in this over, and Australia are stomping into command now
stand and deliver, Warner goes for the big wind-up, under-edges a pull into the crease, but they steal the single anyway
on the pads, and ping! Into the stands over square leg. That was effortless, and huge!
slammed into the stands! Back to back sixes, and this one is a murderous mow, through the line and over long-on!
winding up for another big hit, but this time strikes the pads
good effort from the keeper to take the sting out of a leg glance, but more runs...
a short-arm jab, into the leg side
on the pads, clipped to mid-on
round the wicket, looped up and dipping into the toes, flicked to leg
tapped into the leg side once more
tossed out wide, there's room to free the arms and that is powered through the covers. In the air for a time, but just too much oomph to intercept
punched down the ground
tapped into the off side
round the wicket, hauled through the gap at midiwicket!
back of a length, stabbed into the covers
banged in short, hoisted over backward square leg, and that is an outstanding one-handed grab to cut off the four!
another murderous pull, and this time the same fielder, de Grandhomme, is nutmegged! Up comes a very brisk fifty
a mistimed cut
in the slot for a slog, but Short gets right underneath his shot, comes off the toe, spirals into the sky, and plops into the hands of long on!
nudged to leg
on the toes, clipped firmly to the leg side, he's looking for two and has to scuttle back as Munro swoops and sends in the shy
flicked to the leg side once more
attempted reverse dab, gets in a tangle and topples over as the keeper whips off the bails. The umpires are taking a look but the toe is always anchored over the line
stabbed off the back foot to cover
fully forward, poked back to the bowler
dances at the crease to make room for a thrash through the covers but can't connect properly
bowled him! That's a timely breakthrough, Warner made room to carve a short ball through the covers, but misjudged the pace and back goes his off stump!
crushed into the off side, just short of cover... New Zealand are sensing something here
punched to cover, looking for the single but no way through
squirted into the gap in the covers
a massive wind-up and a missed stumping! A big legbreak, turned through a wild mow across the line, and the keeper was as done in as the batsman ... four byes to add insult to injury
sliding into the legs, can't flick it square
worked down to long on
a frantic swipe at a wide delivery, and this time the keeper makes no mistake! Reached well, whipped off the bails, and Agar is leaving before the third umpire has confirmed his fate. Now then ...
looped up, into the toes, tucked to leg

another unhinged swipe through the line, spirals off the toe of the bat, three men circling at backward point, who wants it? No-one gets there! Plugs just out of reach of the diving Ross Taylor ... well now...
finds the gap at midwicket
worked to the leg side
pulled around the corner to backward square leg
on the back foot, nudged to the leg side
stabbed down the ground, beats the stretching bowler
flicked off the hip out to deep midwicket
back of a length, a bottom-handed bunt out to the leg side
that's a sublime strike, an angled drive into the gap in the covers, timed to perfection, but Southee slides well to intercept just inside the rope
yorker! Well bowled, well dug out
a big smear into the leg side from outside off, almost swings himself off his feet in alacrity
banged in short, an attempted pull, can't connect, and the keeper's shy keeps the non-striker in his place
incredible pick-up from Williamson, but just wide! A tip and run to the covers, Williamson released the ball almost before he had gathered it, and missed the stumps by a whisker!
more brilliance on the boundary! De Grandhomme at full stretch saves the four at deep midwicket. New Zealand are brawling...
tossed up outside off, Maxwell picks the legbreak, gives himself room, and slams it into the stands at long-off!
back of a length, slapped hard and low past the bowler
well bowled, Finch gives himself room and Sodhi cramps him with the googly. Cut to point
wider line, Finch goes for another cut but can't make proper contact
on the legs, worked around the corner
a fast, flat legbreak, Maxwell can't capitalise

a filthy beamer, and a brilliant catch, but it won't count! Slammed out to wide long-on, where the ball is hauled in by Chapman with an excellent relay take, tossing the ball up in mid-air as he clambered back into play
gets away with the free hit
eased out to midwicket
muscled over long-on. That's sweet, sweet power
